title: Foundation: Master Social Media Platforms & Develop Skills
description: A degree in Marketing or Communications is helpful but not mandatory. The key is to become a power user of major platforms (Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn, TikTok, X). Develop strong writing, basic design, and analytical skills.
qualifications: A strong personal or project-based social media presence

title: Internship or Freelance for Small Businesses
description: Gain practical experience by managing social media for a small local business, an NGO, or through an internship at a digital marketing agency. This is where you build a portfolio of real-world results (e.g., follower growth, engagement rates).
qualifications: A portfolio with case studies and metrics

title: Social Media Executive / Specialist
description: Work in a full-time role for a company or agency. You will be responsible for creating and scheduling content, running paid ad campaigns, monitoring social media channels, and reporting on performance against KPIs.
skills: Paid Social Advertising (Meta Ads, LinkedIn Ads)

title: Social Media Manager
description: As a manager, you move from execution to strategy. You will be responsible for developing the overall social media strategy, managing the budget, leading a team (if any), and aligning social media efforts with broader marketing goals.
qualifications: Strong track record of successful campaigns
institutes: All major companies with a digital presence

title: Head of Social / Digital Marketing Manager
description: Advance to a senior leadership role overseeing the entire social or digital marketing function. This role is highly strategic, focusing on brand building, market positioning, and driving significant business results through digital channels.
